SEARCH
Package Signal

Class Signal<T>

java.lang.Object
Signal.Signal<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of the value that is passed to the listener
public class Signal<T> extends Object
A signal is a type of event that can be used to notify other parts of the program when something happens. Signals are useful for decoupling code and allowing for greater flexibility.
Author:
haotian

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public Signal<T>.SignalConnection connect(Consumer<T> callBack)
      Connects a consumer to the signal and returns a SignalConnection object.
      Parameters:
      callBack - the consumer to be connected to the signal
      Returns:
      a SignalConnection object representing the connection

    • await

      public T await()
      Waits for the signal to be fired and returns the value. If the signal is not fired, it waits until the signal is fired. If the waiting is interrupted, it prints a message and returns null.
      Returns:
      the value of the signal, or null if waiting is interrupted

    • fire

      public void fire(T value)
      Sets the value of the signal and notifies all connected SignalConnections.
      Parameters:
      value - the new value to set for the signal

    • disconnectAll

      public void disconnectAll()
      Clears all connections in the signal.

    • disconnectConnection

      private void disconnectConnection(Signal<T>.SignalConnection connection)
      Removes the given connection from the list of connections.
      Parameters:
      connection - the connection to be disconnected

    • finalize

      protected void finalize() throws Throwable
      Overrides the finalize method of the Object class to disconnect all connections before the object is garbage collected.
      Overrides:
      finalize in class Object
      Throws:
      Throwable - if an error occurs during the finalization process
